meanings.definition: In a woful manner; mournfully or sorrowfully.
meanings.sent1: She sang wofully at the funeral, her voice filled with sadness.
meanings.sent2: The old man looked wofully at the empty chair where his wife used to sit.
meanings.sent3: The puppy howled wofully when it lost its favorite toy.
meanings.sent4: The wind whispered wofully through the trees, as if sharing their sorrow.
meanings.sent5: Tears flowed wofully down her cheeks, leaving trails of grief.

meanings.definition: Causing or full of woe; sorrowful or pitiful.
meanings.sent1: The wofully tale of the orphan touched everyone's hearts.
meanings.sent2: The abandoned kitten had a wofully thin frame, in need of care.
meanings.sent3: The wofully sight of the neglected garden made her want to start gardening.
meanings.sent4: The wofully sky seemed to weep along with the grieving widow.
meanings.sent5: His wofully expression revealed the depth of his sorrow.
